text: hello everyone in this video I'm going
to demonstrate how to subscribe to email
notifications for security services
using the AWS user notification service
this demonstration will be for AWS
activat and Amazon guard Duty let's
start with AWS
artifact AWS artifact is a self-service
audit artifa retrieval portter that
provides our customers with OnDemand
access to either WS compliance
documentation and AWS
agreements AWS artifact enable you to
set up email notifications on the
notification setting page in AWS artifi
you can subscribe to notifications and
manage other notification settings I
will show in this video AWS artifa sends
notifications using the AWS user
notification service so you will need to
specify the region
where your user notification data will
be stored I've navigated into the AWS
console for the demonstration on AWS
artifact first you have to set up
notification Ops from the AWS console
search for AWS user notifications in the
search
bar click on AWS user notifications
click on notification OBS in the left
hand side of the navigation
page by default your user notification
data will be stored in US E1 region and
will be replicated across the other
regions that you select click on edit if
you want to include additional
notification Ops you have the option to
select up to three not notification
Ops for this demo we are going to leave
our region as
default next you need to create a
configuration from the AWS console
search for AWS artified in the search
bar click on AWS
certifi click on notification settings
in the left hand side of the navigation
pan click on create
configuration to receive notifications
for agreement keep the check box
selected next to update on AWS
agreement to receive notification for
reports keep the check box selected next
to update on AWS
reports to receive notification for all
reports keep the check box selected next
to all reports to receive notification
only for reports under specific
categories and series click the check
box for a subset of reports for this
demo we'll leave it as all
reports enter unique name for your
configuration
enter the email
address for more than one email enter a
comma separated list of emails where
notifications should be
sent Skip the tag
section then click on create
configuration
a verification email will be sent to the
provided email address and the email
recipient will need to click verify
email link within the verification email
sent to them please note that only
verified email address will start
receiving
notification that is how you subscribe
to email notifications for the AWS
artifact service now let's see how you
can create a user alert for a guide Dy
finding using the AWS user notifications
service Amazon guard duty is a thread
detection service that continuously
monitors your AWS accounts and workloads
for malicious activities and delivers
detailed security findings for
visibility and
Remediation let's go into the AWS
console for the demo from the AWS
console search for AWS user
notifications in the search
bar click on AWS user
notifications click on notification
configuration in the left hand side of
the navigation
pen click on create notification
configuration enter a unique name for
your
configuration
enter a description if you want
to select gu Duty from the AWS service
name drop
down select gu Dy finding from the event
type drop
down select the AWS regions you want the
event to be sourced
from at least one region must be
selected
here click on the advanced filter
dropdown if you want to customize your
event R this allows you to add any
sample Json code of your choice for
customization of your finding
I'll leave this as
default you can also click on add
another event through if you have more
than one
customization choose receive within 5
minutes under aggregation
settings select the delivery Channel as
you see fit this is optional
you will still be able to see
notifications in the notification center
if you do not add any delivery
channels for this demo I'll leave it as
default leave manage tag as
optional click on create notification
configuration we can see the status here
showing
inactive this should turn back into
active within few
seconds now we can see that the status
is active
now and that's it with this you have Set
up notification alert for your gu detail
findings feel free to explore AWS
documentation
to see how you can use the AWS user
notifications functionality for other
Security Service events thanks for
watching
